Articles.Content:
This is a continuation of the idea of the well-known Audio Muffler mod by NovaSilisko

Its purpose is to make game sounds feel more realistic by muffling them as the air around your vessel gets less dense.

here will be a video demonstrating the mod's features later

License: CC BY-NC-SA

Source code: on GitHub 

Supported KSP version: 1.5.x

Download from SpaceDock

A serious redux of the original version was made to be able to implement some new features as

  • Cabin sounds are not muffled when you are inside it
  • Music is not muffled anymore
  • In atmosphere sounds feel different if they happen outside your vessel from the ones inside
  • While on IVA in space you can hear your own engines and can't hear anything outside your vessel

If you get bored by totally silent space, you may edit the mod's config file (Audio Muffler Redux/PluginData/AudioMuffler Redux/muffler.cfg) and set the "minimalCutoff" to 300. Doing so you'll get the original mod's behaviour when sounds in space were not muffled to none but to "nothing more than a deep bass rumble" instead.

More settings:

helmetOutsideIVA - hear helmet and cabin sounds (e.g. Chatterer, alarms etc.) in flight when not on IVA
helmetOutsideEVA - hear helmet sounds when on EVA and not in 1st person view

helmetForUnmanned - enables you, as a remote operator, to hear beeps and alarms of an unmanned vessel even from outside view

helmetInMapView - hear helmet sounds in Map view
vesselInMapView - hear muffled sounds from distant parts of your vessel in Map view
outsideInMapView - hear muffled outside sounds in Map view (actually, doesn't make much significant difference)

 

For first person view on EVA you can use the Through the Eyes of a Kerbal mod

Edited November 29, 2018 by Ser
Finally.  You are amazing my man
Wooho
How to install?
Have my babies!

Just now, Starslinger999 said:

How to install?

put Audio Muffler Redux into your gamedata folder

K Thx

Edited October 12, 2016 by Starslinger999

No pics, no clicks.

(FYI, for all you fuddy-duddies: that was a joke (or an attempt at one anyway). YMMV.)
WooHoo! a continuation of a favourite of mine.

I see you've made the sound go to complete silence. Old Muffler didn't. That's ok, even better now.

But the music when you get to orbit, it starts suddenly and ... RIP, headphone users. LOL
BRAVO!  Thank you!

8 hours ago, lajoswinkler said:

I see you've made the sound go to complete silence. Old Muffler didn't. That's ok, even better now.

I wrote in the OP how to bring back that behavior. Because most likely people will start to go mad of that eternal silence of the Universe. IRL astronauts are not in total silence because they are inside pressurized vessel most of the time and (I suppose) they are inside when engines are firing, unlike kerbocraft operators

8 hours ago, lajoswinkler said:

But the music when you get to orbit, it starts suddenly and ... RIP, headphone users. LOL

I've thought about making it gradually fade in but that'll require some extra logic. Personally I usually set music level to 10% for not having fanfares sound louder than rockets and explosions.
Damn, just noticed that Chatterer is eaten by the muffler. Shall look for fix.
Thank you. You have no idea how much I appreciate this.

4 hours ago, Ser said:

I wrote in the OP how to bring back that behavior. Because most likely people will start to go mad of that eternal silence of the Universe. IRL astronauts are not in total silence because they are inside pressurized vessel most of the time and (I suppose) they are inside when engines are firing, unlike kerbocraft operators

I've thought about making it gradually fade in but that'll require some extra logic. Personally I usually set music level to 10% for not having fanfares sound louder than rockets and explosions.

It's ok because you can hear it inside the pod. It makes the gameplay very realistic. I don't mind the silence. It makes me alert upon landing on atmospheric bodies. I need to check how this affects Duna, though.

Would it be possible to make the Kerbals' jets audible? After all, it's a Kerbal itself and engines are attached to their bodies.

30 minutes ago, lajoswinkler said:

Would it be possible to make the Kerbals' jets audible? After all, it's a Kerbal itself and engines are attached to their bodies.

So you don't hear vessel's engines but want to hear EVA jets? Don't think that's consistent. But if we speak of 1st person view, take a look at RCS Sound: "Planned features: Sounds for the EVA jetpack." If the sound source will be properly positioned it should not be muffled and thus should be fully audible.

8 minutes ago, Ser said:

So you don't hear vessel's engines but want to hear EVA jets? Don't think that's consistent. But if we speak of 1st person view, take a look at RCS Sound: "Planned features: Sounds for the EVA jetpack." If the sound source will be properly positioned it should not be muffled and thus should be fully audible.

But we don't have a 1st person view. Granted, if we did, audible RCS would be applicable to such situation, but we don't.

3 hours ago, lajoswinkler said:

But we don't have a 1st person view. Granted, if we did, audible RCS would be applicable to such situation, but we don't.

 But we have mods

1 hour ago, Ser said:

 But we have mods

There's a mod for 1st person view?

22 minutes ago, lajoswinkler said:

There's a mod for 1st person view?

I know a pair of them. The most popular is HullCam VDS that has a 1st person feature and there's a little one 1st Person EVA, with no extras, that I used to recompile time to time and going to try to do that for 1.2.

Edited October 13, 2016 by Ser

A solution for the Chatterer compatibility issue has been found, so as soon as I quit messing with EVA issues a fix will be published. It will include a cool feature that lets you hear Chatterer and other helmet/cabin sounds only when you are "in a kerbal", be that IVA or 1st person EVA. That will be optional of course.

10 hours ago, Ser said:

A solution for the Chatterer compatibility issue has been found, so as soon as I quit messing with EVA issues a fix will be published. It will include a cool feature that lets you hear Chatterer and other helmet/cabin sounds only when you are "in a kerbal", be that IVA or 1st person EVA. That will be optional of course.

Is the fix released?

11 hours ago, ockidj said:

Is the fix released?

Not yet, but will be soon TM

Edited October 15, 2016 by Ser

Version 2.1 is ready

Download here

Changes:

  • Fixed helmet/cabin sounds issue ("Chatterer compatibility")
  • Added helmet channel and options to disable helmet sounds outside IVA and EVA
  • Added options to disable helmet, vessel and outside sounds in Map view

For configuration description read the OP or .cfg file comments. In brief, the defaults are: 

helmetOutsideIVA = true
helmetOutsideEVA = true

Means that Chatterer sounds will be audible everywhere, just as before. Set both to false to get "full IVA experience" . 

helmetInMapView = false
vesselInMapView = true
outsideInMapView = false

Means that only vessel engines will be audible in Map view.

Set all five to false for full realism or to true to have "almost stock" configuration.

Edited October 15, 2016 by Ser
